column1: 2 ^ Voce mea ad Dòminum clamávi~; voce mea ad Deum
column2: et intèndit mìhi. ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~; to God with my voice
column3: and he gave ear to me.

column1: 3 ^ In die tribulatiónis meaĕ Deum exqŭisívi
column3: et non sum decèptus~; renúvit consolári ánima mea. ^ In the days of my trouble I sought God
column4: with my hands lifted up to him in the night
column5: and I was not deceived~; my soul refused to be comforted.

column1: 4 ^ Mèmor fui Dei
column4: et defécit spíritus meus. ^ I remembered God

column1: 5 ^ Anticipavérunt vigìlias òculi mei~; turbátus sum
column2: et non sum locútus. ^ My eyes prevented the watches~; I was troubled

column1: 6 ^ Cogitávi dies antíquos
column2: et annos aĕtèrnos in mente hábui
column3: ^ I thought upon the days of old
column4: and I had in my mind the eternal years.

column1: 7 ^ Et meditátus sum nocte cum corde meo
column3: et scopébam spíritum meum. ^ And I meditated in the night with my own heart
column4: and I was exercised and I swept my spirit.

column1: 8 ^ ¿~Numqŭid in aĕtèrnum projìciet Deus
column2: et non appónet ut complacìtior sit adhûc~? ^ Will God then cast off for ever
column3: and will he never be more favourable again~?

column1: 9 ^ ¿~Aŭt in finem misericórdiam suam abscìndet
column2: a generatióne in generatiónem~? ^ Or will he cut off his mercy for ever

column1: 10 ^ ¿~Aŭt obliviscétur miseréri Deus~? ¿~Aŭt continébit in ira sua misericórdias suas~? ^ Or will God forget to show mercy~? Or will he in his anger shut up his mercies~?
11 ^ Et dixi
column2: «~Nunc coĕpi~; haĕc mutátio dèxteraĕ Excèlsi.~»^ And I said
column3: "Now have I begun~; this is the change of the right hand of the most High."

column1: 12 ^ Mèmor fui óperum Dòmini
column2: qŭia mèmor èro ab inìtio mirabílium tuórum
column3: ^ I remembered the works of the Lord
column4: for I will be mindful of thy wonders from the beginning.

column1: 13 ^ et meditábor in òmnibus opèribus tuîs
column2: et in adinventiónibus tuîs exercébor. ^ And I will meditate on all thy works
column3: and will be employed in thy inventions.

column1: 14 ^ Deus
column2: in sancto via tua~; ¿~qŭìs Deus magnus sicut Deus noster~? ^ Thy way
column4: is in the holy place~; who is the great God like our God~?

column1: 15 ^ Tu ès Deus qŭi facis mirabìlia~; notam fecìsti in pòpulîs virtútem tuam. ^ Thou art the God that dost wonders~; thou hast made thy power known among the nations.
16 ^ Redemìsti in bráchio tuo pòpulum tuum
column2: fílios Jacóbis et Josífis. ^ With thy arm thou hast redeemed thy people
column3: the children of Jacob and of Joseph.

column1: 17 ^ Vîdérunt te aqŭaĕ
column4: et turbátaĕ sunt abìssi. ^ The waters saw thee
column5: O God~; the waters saw thee

column1: 18 ^ Multitúdo sonátûs aquárum~; vocem dedérunt nubes
column2: ètenim sagìttaĕ tuaĕ tránseunt. ^ Great are the roarings of the waters~; the clouds sent out a sound

column1: 19 ^ Vox tonìtrui tui in rota~; illuxérunt coruscatiónes tuaĕ orbi terraĕ~; commóta èst
column2: et contrèmuit terra. ^ The voice of thy thunder in a wheel~; thy lightnings enlightened the world~; the earth shook and trembled.

column1: 20 ^ In mari via tua
column2: et sémitaĕ tuaĕ in aqŭîs multîs
column3: et vestígia tua non cognoscèntur. ^ Thy way is in the sea
column4: and thy paths in many waters
column5: and thy footsteps shall not be known.

column1: 21 ^ Deduxìsti sicut oves pòpulum tuum
column2: in manu Mosis et Aharónis. ^ Thou hast conducted thy people like sheep
column3: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
